column5: I have never fished the south end of simcoe.   Do people downrig for lakers in the spring or is it a waste of time?  How about casting for pike or is it no good?  any tips on where to try for pike?    thanks for any help.

Cooks bay has a lot of pike. When i lived close to Lake Simcoe i would do really well fishing right after the season opened in early may. Try suspending jerk baits like the husky jerk or spinner baits close to the reeds, near the mouth of the holland river. The pike will be shallow.

i dont fish simcoe but i know you dont need downriggers in the spring for lakers they are usually close to shore shallow ive always caught them casting williams wobblers ive caught lakers in 4 feet of water in may good luck
Well dont forget the whities as well.  Hope this works.I been playing.  Didnt work so heres some pictures.
Glen if you got the boat to go,give me a pm.I would be glad to share and get out with you.Kinda hard to put riggers on a bass boat.Boy miss the down rigg,n.
Good advice. With the warm temps that are coming, they will be right on the bite.
Thanks guys.  I will give it a try.  Brian pm sent.
Dang, that's one handsome family, Brian.  Great fish pics too.
Not a bad looking guy for 68 YOA.Guys in better shape then you or I.
Me, that's no contest.  You, on the other hand, that says something.  My Pa is 74 and mebbe if I sneak up behind him and get a shot in, I could take him.

You know douG, I was thinking the same thing, and it got me thinking who does Brian really look like? Well it then came to me...  can you say Mythbusters!!     Brian..    What do you think?!!!  Sorry Glen for the hijack, but I couldn't resist!!!
